Description: Rim and neck sherd of Laconian black-glazed pottery krater; interior glazed; exterior: glazed on top of thick flat rim; slipped white around edge of rim with painted decoration consisting of black paired hook maeander pattern between two rows of dots; below, neck glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd is from a krater similar to, but differing in detail from Alexandria 17283. For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.649.a and 1888,0601.649.b. Stibbe places this sherd in the Group with hook maeander of his Group E, the group of kraters with geometric rim ornaments only (Stibbe, 1989, 35).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 561, no. E 43)
Stibbe 1989 / Laconian Mixing Bowls. A history of the Krater Lakonikos from the 7th to the 5th century BC (p. 103)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.48) (phase 3)
